attributes.action: Revoke article 16 and retain the protocol
attributes.additional_details: Triggering article 16 would be a violation of the good friday agreement and it would be unfair to those who lives near the border in Northern Ireland. So sign this petition to press the government not the introduce any article 16
attributes.background: There is no way the government can introduce or trigger articles 16. By triggering article 16 this will lead to alot of problems in northern ireland and this can lead to the borders of the past and the violence of the past.

rejection.details:
Article 16 is part of the Northern Ireland Protocol agreed by the UK and EU, so cannot be unilaterally revoked by the UK.

We have published the following petition calling for a similar action, which you might like to sign:

Resolve any trade issues without triggering Article 16: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/573928
